subject: Russ Mitchell: Catching Up With Capitol Bob
body:
CBSNews.com












  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 



                                                                            
      May 23, 
  2007


 
 

Hi. I'm Russ 
      Mitchell and here's a recap of this morning's Early 
      Show. 
Chief Washington 
      Correspondent Bob 
      Schieffer was in today to talk about a wide range of topics including 
      the recent GOP debate, the war in Iraq and 
      the possibility that Al Gore will enter the race for the White House. 
      You can catch Bob's "Capitol Bob" segments weekly on The Early 
      Show. 
 Hannah spoke with 
      Florida Gov. Charlie Crist about the record high price of gasoline. 
      Crist is one of 22 governors asking Congress to investigate the 
      skyrocketing cost of gas. 

Susan Koeppen was 
      here to bring us a report on new ways to get rid of cellulite. Dr. Emily Senay gave us 
      tips on battling heartburn. We met America's Hottest Husband according to Redbook 
      Magazine. Ray Martin joined us to give us advice on paying off those student loans and Julie hosted a 
      fashion show of swimsuits for all body 
      types. 

Lot's more 
      tomorrow, including a chat with jazz great Wynton Marsalis and a look at 
      the new CSI museum in Chicago! 
 See you 
      then.. 
 
      


Russ 
      Mitchell
EarlyShow@cbs.com
